name: Ensure you provide enough comment for your Classes
Avoid empty finally blocks
Avoid Artifacts with lines longer than X characters
Avoid empty catch blocks
Avoid Classes with a High Number Of Children
Avoid large Artifacts - too many Lines of Code
Avoid undocumented Classes
Ensure you have a number of local methods and remote methods called by methods in the Class below a predefined threshold
Ensure you don't forget the default clause in your switch statement
Ensure you don't use multiple break statement in 'for' loops
Ensure you keep simple the design of the component/module to reduce number of independent paths
Ensure you have enough comment your code (HTML5/Javascript)
Avoid using querySelectorAll, prefer getElementsByTagName() or getElementsByClassName() to have better performance.
Make sure you do not execute a function inside loop termination to avoid performance issues, use a variable to store the value of a function instead
Replace for-in loop with a regular for loop with index to avoid slower performance
Replace forEach() with a regular loop to ensure better performance
Ensure that the web-service calls made from the client are not inside a loop so that efficiency is not impacted due to communications overhead
Ensure having a process queue that will manage all the requests with a limited number of concurrents when making calls to web services
Ensure to use intermediate variables for minimizing dot notations for references within a loop so that performance is not adversely impacted
Make sure that you do not use Web SQL databases
Use asynchronous loading of Javascript files or code to avoid a single point of failure in page loading
Prevent Cross Site Scripting on your page by making sure you do not use form and formaction attributes in submitted markup
Make sure the Html submit markup related to 'form' does not have id attribute to avoid to prevent cross site scripting
Prevent Cross Site Scripting on your page by making sure you do not use autofocus and onfocus in submitted markup
Prevent Cross Site Scripting on your page by making sure you do not use autofocus and onblur in a submitted markup
Protect your page from Cross Site Scripting by making sure you don't use javascript and expressions in your CSS files
Make sure you do not use video poster attributes in combination with javascript to prevent Cross Site Scripting on your page by
Make sure to use "srcdoc" only in combination with the Iframe Sandbox to prevent XSS attacks that might slip through
Make sure you do not use onscroll event with autofocus input to prevent Cross Site Scripting on your page by
Ensure to assign a reference variable to a function output if it has to be used inside a loop to make performance better
Avoid using delete with no object properties
Ensure protection from Clickjacking by not using iframe inside a tag
Make sure you do not allow text injection by using setData in ondragstart with attribute draggable set to true
Make sure you do not use oninput in body containing input autofocus to prevent Cross Site Scripting on your page
Make sure you do not use <Source> tag in video/audio event handlers to prevent Cross Site Scripting on your page by
Avoid importing content from an untrusted source like dirname
Ensure you do not import content from an untrusted source and are limited to same origin to prevent Cross Site Scripting
To delete or remove an index element from an array use splice, pop or shift rather than delete to prevent empty indexes
Ensure using document.getElementById() instead of documetn.all to avoid slow loading of DOM elements
Eval() should not be used because it runs text as code.
Ensure you remove console.log() in your production code
Make sure that you have only one instance created in class constructor and it has been frozen to avoid any changes.
Ensure that there are no references to subclass in the superclass to subdue complexity of your code
Ensure to not use Javascript Function constructor calling a string represented source code to prevent impaired performance
Ensure that you are not using a break or return statement inside a finally block, to avoid dead code
Ensure not having hard-coded network resources names in the source files (Javascript)
Make sure to not access the database from Javascript directly, instead create dedicated modules for the same
Ensure to disable the auto-complete feature in input forms, especially for fields such as passwords, to avoid access that should be unauthorized
Aggregate method parameters into an object to improve readability and maintainability of your code
Avoid using setTimeout with a string as first argument
Avoid using setInterval with a string as first argument
Enrich your code with comments to give an overview of the code to improve maintainability
Move JavaScript functions from HTML file to a '.js' file
Always enable HttpOnly option when creating cookies so that sensitive information is not exposed to unsecured applications and domains
Make sure you are using Secure option for cookies so that Cross-Site-Scripting attacks can be prevented
Ensure you do not allow access to all domain when defining cookie path
Make sure to accurately define the path of the web application/s for which this cookie is valid
Always use JSON.parse & JSON.stringify with try/catch block because of the synchronous call(Javascript)
Ensure you don't hard-code password in the source file, hackers can steal the information by retro-engineering your application (Javascript)
Ensure the data property to return objects from a function
Ensure get() function always return a value
Ensure you don't use <textarea> with child elements such as inner text, if it has the v-model attribute
Ensure that you define a key for v-for
Prefer using a computed property as a condition, if needed, instead of using v-for and v-if on the same element
Avoid using v-show directive inside templates
Ensure that you use $emit to emit events instead of $parent to directly change parent props, to maintain the vue philosophy of props down events up
Ensure to clear event listeners after components are destroyed to prevent memory leaks
Ensure using only secured cookie to avoid Cross-site scripting attacks (Vue.js)
Ensure you do not allow access to all domain when defining cookie path (Vue.js)
Avoid creating cookie with overly broad domain (Vue.js)
Ensure that you are not making API/web service calls inside loops so that performance is not severely impacted
Ensure you minize the number of web service ajax calls inside a loop
Ensure you don't use the element type in your selector when using class selectors in jQuery.
Ensure using find for Id->Child nested selectors for better performance
Always cache your jQuery selector, based on class, returned objects in variables for reuse.
Prefer using "type=" notation instead of ":".
Ensure not using anonymous functions to attach events because they are difficult to debug, maintain, test or reuse
Ensure you don't manipulate stylesheet with css() method to avoid performance issue
Ensure you don't universal selectors to avoid performance issue.
Ensure you don't use officially jQuery deprecated methods
Ensure you don't use jQuery $.cookie because it is deprecated
Ensure you use Ajax method with dataType with jQuery version older than 3.0.0
Ensure you use dialog with closeText parameter with jQuery UI version older than 1.12
Ensure you don't use html() with jQuery 1.9.0 (or older)
Ensure you don't use $(location.hash) with jQuery version older than 1.6.3
Ensure you don't use .append() after() with jQuery 1.4.2 (or older)
Ensure you don't use attr() with jQuery 3.0.0-rc1
Ensure you don't use Dialog widget from jQuery UI with version older than 1.10.0
Ensure you don't use Tooltip widget from jQuery UI with version older than 1.10.0
Ensure you have implemented expected $ajax callbacks
Ensure you have properly manage errors by using the error/fail callbacks
Ensure you have overwritten component methods to properly catch errors
Ensure you have properly use the componentDidCatch to better manage errors
Prefer not using the function dangerouslySetInnerHTML
Ensure you don't inject javascript code into your HTML template.
Ensure using only secured cookie to avoid Cross-site scripting attacks
Prefer using angular.forEach() instead of JS implementation [].forEach for an AngularJS app to enhance performace
Prefer using angular.fromJson and angular.toJson instead of standard JS APIs to improve maintainability and robustness of your code
Ensure that you are not making API/web service calls inside loops so that performance is not severely impacted
Prefer using 'this' instead of $scope in controllers to generate views to ensure consistency and structuredness in code
Prefer using AngularJS wrapper service $document to maintain structuredness of code
Prefer using AngularJS wrapper service $window to maintain structuredness of code
Prefer using AngularJS wrapper service $timeout to maintain structuredness of code
Prefer using AngularJS wrapper service angular.isDefined or angular.isUndefined to maintain structuredness of code
Prefer using AngularJS wrapper service angular.isArray instead of default JS implementation to maintain structuredness of code
Prefer using AngularJS wrapper service angular.isDate instead of default JS implementation to maintain structuredness of code
Prefer using AngularJS wrapper service angular.isFunction instead of default JS implementation to maintain structuredness of code
Prefer using AngularJS wrapper service angular.isString instead of default JS implementation to maintain structuredness of code
Prefer using AngularJS wrapper service angular.isObject instead of default JS implementation to maintain structuredness of code
Prefer using AngularJS wrapper service angular.isNumber instead of default JS implementation to maintain structuredness of code
Prefer using AngularJS wrapper service angular.isRegex instead of default JS implementation to maintain structuredness of code
Ensure that you do not use NOT operator with a logical check to prevent unexpected results
Prefer using Factory() provider recipe instead of Service() to ensure structuredness and efficiency
Ensure that you are not using a web service inside loops so that performance is not severely impacted
Prefer using Angular wrapper service instead of using $ or Jquery.element to ensure structuredness
Ensure that you do not use a jQuery wrapper on angular.element to ensure structuredness in code
Prefer using $http methods 'then' and 'catch' instead of 'success' and 'error' as the latter returns original promise when you chain off of them
Ensure activating Content-Security-Policy in you  angular applications to enforce client-side templates protection
Ensure to keep enabled the Strict Contextual Escaping to make code secure by default and for easy auditing for vulnerabilities
Ensure to use $sanitize service in AngularJS apps to prevent Data Injection attacks
Make sure you do not disable withCredentials option for httpProvider
Ensure your web application interactivity by using 'track by' option in 'ng-repeat' block
Make sure you do not allow 'Javascript' and 'http' as accepted protocols to avoid Cross-site-scripting

Ensure you do not allow access to all domain when defining cookie path (AngularJS)

You should set the process.exitCode to allow the process exiting naturally rather than calling process.exit() directly.
The variables "__dirname" and "__filename" should not be used in string concatenation to avoid having an invalid path
Ensure activating Content-Security-Policy HTTP header to avoid untrusted source
Ensure disabling X-Powered-By header in your express instance or use third-party helmet package to prevent specifically-targeted attacks on running applications
Ensure enabling X-XSS-Protection header to prevent attackers submitting malicious script to unsuspecting users
Ensure setting the X-Frame-Options in your express instance or use third-party helmet package to avoid Clickjacking attacks
Ensure having only one routing handler per path to avoid an efficiency issue
“http.get” or “http.request” should not be used inside a loop to optimize the number of calls between the client application and web service server
Ensure setting up the No Cache headers in your express instance or use third-party helmet package to avoid catching bad information.
Ensure setting the Strict-Transport-Security HTTP header to secure and encrypt communications to the Node.js server
Ensure building secured HTTPS server using certificate to avoid connection to unsecured source.
Ensure enabling sanitize option for marked component to avoid any security hole
Ensure you have enable CSRF Protection to avoid Cross-Site forgery risk.
Always enable HttpOnly when creating cookies to avoid Cross-site scripting attacks
Ensure you have closed  Node.js filesystem after using open or openSync.
Ensure not using MD5/SHA1 hashes for cryptographic functions of NodeJs to avoid sensitive data being compromised
Ensure using only secured cookie to avoid Cross-site scripting attacks
Ensure enabling NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED attributes allowing rejecting self signed certificates
Ensure you have enable SSL verification in node-curl
Ensure you do not allow access to all domain when defining cookie path (Node.js)
Avoid creating cookie with overly broad domain (Node.js)
Ensure you don't use TLS library from NodeJS with version older than 9.11.2 and 10.4.1
Ensure you don't use HTTP/2 llibrary from  NodeJS with version older than 6.14.13, 8.11.3, 9.11.2 and 10.4.1
Ensure you minize the number of api call especially inside a loop
Ensure you don't use normalizeStringWin32 method of Path module with Node.js 8.5.0

Ensure you don't use Buffer with UC2 encoding from NodeJS with version older than 6.14.4, 8.11.4 and 10.9.0
Ensure you don't reference url.parse wich using javascript protocol with NodeJS  version older than 6.15.0, 8.14.0, 10.14.0 and 11.3.0
Ensure you don't use the path module from NodeJS with version older than 4.9.0
Ensure you don't use 'ps' package' methods from NodeJS with version older than 1.0.0

Use common database libraries handling SQL code provide specific API to perform parameterized SQL queries to assure sanitized SQL queries.

Ensure you don't have multiple artifacts inserting data on the same NoSQL table
Ensure you don't have multiple artifacts deleting data on the same NoSQL table

Ensure you no longer us Buffer() function or new Buffer() constructor because they are deprecated

Ensure you don't deserialize data using node-serialize package version 0.5.0
Ensure you don't use moment before 2.19.3 functions

Always throw all created error.
Prefer refactoring the source code  instead of using console logging
Preferusing  Number.isNaN() instead NaN in comparison
Eval() should not be used because it runs text as code.
